title: (x) Johnson Controls logo sans - Corisande {Angel}
content:
Any one know what face the are using for the new johnson controls logo?

[http://prn.newscom.com/cgi-bin/pub/s?f=PRN/prnpub&p1=20070930/AQSU001LOG...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150121023801/http:/prn.newscom.com/cgi-bin/pub/s?f=PRN/prnpub&p1=20070930/AQSU001LOGO&xtag=PRN-prnphotos-65588&redir=preview&tr=1&row=1 "http://prn.newscom.com/cgi-bin/pub/s?f=PRN/prnpub&p1=20070930/AQSU001LOGO&xtag=PRN-prnphotos-65588&redir=preview&tr=1&row=1")

or if it's custom; faces that are close.
author: voiceof

comments.content: the lower case l and the upper case J are wrong though...

not Dax... daxline is closer in terms of the geometric qualities, but the spur on the top left of the n and the longer tail on the t set it apart from Daxline - in addition to being wider, particularly the uppercase C. I can't find anything closer though!
Nah, it's a slightly customised Corisande. Angel was right all along.
